data.title: Maria Canals-Barrera
authors: Contributors to Wizards of Waverly Place Wiki
data.meta_description: Maria Canals-Barrera is an American actor. She is mainly known for playing Theresa Russo on Wizards of Waverly Place. She reprised her role in the 2024 sequel series. Maria Canals was born and raised in Miami, Florida, to Cuban parents of Catalan descent. Canals-Barrera also speaks Spanish and...
data.text:
Maria Canals-Barrera is an American actor. She is mainly known for playing Theresa Russo on Wizards of Waverly Place. She reprised her role in the 2024 sequel series.

Personal Life[]

Maria Canals was born and raised in Miami, Florida, to Cuban parents of Catalan descent. Canals-Barrera also speaks Spanish and took drama classes in junior high school. Canals-Barrera graduated from Hialeah-Miami Lakes Senior High School before winning a theatrical scholarship to the University of Miami. Barrera has been married to actor David Barrera since 1999, with whom she has two daughters.

Career[]

In her early years, Canals-Barrera worked extensively in Los Angeles and Miami theaters. In 1990, she starred as Amanda in a production of The Class Menagerie. In 1992, she starred in a production of Brian Michael Riley's A Cradle of Sparrows, in addition to starring on Telemundo Spanish-language telenovela Marielena. She later had a recurring role in the short-lived 1993 Fox comedy-drama series Key West. In the 1990s, Canals-Barrera also guest-starred in numerous television series. In 1996, she starred as the title character in the production of Hedda Gabler. The following year, she played Digna in Guillermo Reyes' Chilean Holiday production.

Her first regular role was on The Tony Danza Show in 1997. In the early 2000s, Canals-Barrera had supporting roles in films America's Sweethearts, The Master of Disguise, and Imaging Argentina. In recent years, she gained much recognition from comic book fans for her role as Hawkgirl/Shayera Hol on Bruce Timm's Justice League animated series and Justice League Unlimited. She also had a recurring role in Static Shock as news reporter Shelly Sandoval and in Danny Phantom as Paulina, the title character's high school crush. She also performed the voice of Mercedes "Meche" Colomar in the 1998 game Grim Fandango. Canals-Barrera also played random characters in two TV series episodes, The Boondocks(Grandad's Fight and Home Alone).

From 2007 to 2012, Canals-Barred co-starred as Theresa Russo in the Wizards of Waverly Place. She also co-starred in Wizards of Waverly Place: The Movie. Canals-Barrera also appeared as Connie Torres in Camp Rock(2008) and Camp Rock 2: The Final Jam(2010). In 2011 she appeared in the romantic comedy Larry Crowne.

In 2014, Canals-Barrera was cast as Hilda in Members Only. Later that year, she joined the cast of Cristela as Cristela Alonozo's character sister. On August 27, 2018, TV Line revealed that Canals-Barrera was cast as the mother of Hernandez-Guerrero-Fernandez-Guerrero on the Netflix series Fuller House.
